sentences.english: If you don't get straightened out, you will end up in jail.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不改邪归正的话，最终要进监狱的。

sentences.english: Maybe religion should help to straighten him out.
sentences.chinese: 也许宗教信仰可以使他改邪归正。

sentences.english: However, he thought, is right, with all my heart from crime career.
sentences.chinese: 然而他一心所想，却是改邪归正，摆脱犯罪生涯。

sentences.english: A smile to turn any sinner saintly.
sentences.chinese: 她的微笑足以让任何罪人改邪归正。

sentences.english: You'll find yourself in prison if you don't mend your way.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不改邪归正，你肯定要进监狱的。

sentences.english: Fixing wrong doings and returning to socialism is the only correct way!
sentences.chinese: 改邪归正爸，回到社会主义才是唯一正确的路。

sentences.english: home， Changhu knelt before his mother， bitterly remorseful. He finally gave up evil and returned to good.
sentences.chinese: 长怙回来后跪在母亲面前，悔恨交加，从此改邪归正。

sentences.english: The seven trumpets are God's warning to humans to repent and change their ways.
sentences.chinese: 七枝号代表上帝给人的警告，要我们悔罪并改邪归正。
